# Overview

## The Marine and Freshwater Research Institute Iceland

The Marine and Freshwater Research Institute (MFRI) in Iceland is dedicated to research on marine and freshwater ecosystems. Our mission is to provide scientific knowledge and advice to support sustainable management of aquatic resources. The institute conducts extensive research on fish stocks, marine mammals, seabirds, and the marine environment.

![MFRI Logo](https://www.hafogvatn.is/static/files/Veidar/MFRI_logo.png){style="float:right;padding: 0 0 0 10px;" fig-alt="MFRI Logo" width="200"}

## About Iceland {#sec-about-iceland}

Iceland is a Nordic island country in the North Atlantic Ocean, known for its stunning landscapes, including volcanoes, geysers, hot springs, and lava fields. The capital and largest city is Reykjavík. Iceland is renowned for its strong commitment to environmental sustainability and renewable energy.

![Iceland Logo](https://example.com/path/to/iceland_logo.png){style="float:right;padding: 0 0 0 10px;" fig-alt="Iceland Logo" width="200"}

# ICES WGFAST {#sec-ices-wgfast}

The International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES) Working Group on Fisheries Acoustics, Science and Technology (WGFAST) focuses on the development and application of acoustic methods to assess fish and other marine organisms. WGFAST provides a forum for scientists to exchange knowledge and advance the use of acoustics in fisheries research.

![ICES Logo](https://www.ices.dk/SiteCollectionImages/ICES%20logos/ICES_logo_2018.png){style="float:right;padding: 0 0 0 10px;" fig-alt="ICES Logo" width="200"}
